info.title: IT Collect
info.description:
The IT Dashboard team aims to build a modern API that acts as the center-piece of a modular IT data reporting ecosystem. This OpenAPI spec shows the initial direction of ITCollect data architecture and is aimed at providing real-time updates to the IT Collect API. It will serve as living documentation of the latest changes.

# Authentication

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of Rebaseline resources.

GetRebaselineItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /v1/rebaselines/{id}`.

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of Services resources.

GetServicesItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /v1/services/{id}`.

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of CioRating resources.

GetCioRatingItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /v1/services/{service}/cio-ratings/{id}`.

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of Contract resources.

GetContractItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /v1/services/{service}/contracts/{id}`.

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of Ledger resources.

GetLedgerItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /v1/services/{service}/ledgers/{id}`.

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of Metric resources.

GetMetricItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /v1/services/{service}/metrics/{id}`.

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of MetricActuals resources.

GetMetricActualsItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /v1/services/{service}/metrics/{metric}/actuals/{id}`.

get.summary: Retrieves the collection of Projects resources.

GetProjectsItem.description: The `id` value returned in the response can be used as the `id` parameter in `GET /v1/services/{service}/projects/{id}`.

  • This value is not a valid date.
  • ActivityCompletionDate

plannedTotalCost.description:
The planned total cost for the activity. [$M] Note: For programs that are employing earned value management, Agencies should reflect "budget at completion" in the "Total Costs Planned" Column 11 and "estimated at completion" in the "Total Costs Projected" Column 12. This is a baseline field.
Validations
  • This value should not be blank.
  • This value should be positive.

structureId.description:
Agency-specified identifier that indicates the work breakdown structure (WBS) the Agency uses to associate the activity with other activities or a project. Provide this in the format of "x.x.x.x.x" where the first string is the Unique Project ID and each following string (separated by periods) matches the structure ID of a parent activity. See below for more guidance about parent and child activities expressed through this structure. [x.x.x.x.x]
Validations
  • This value should not be blank.
  • The structureId, {{ structureId }} you have provided does not contain a valid {{ missingValue }}. Please provide a proper value

Validations

rating.description:
CIOs best judgment of the current level of risk for the Investment in terms of its ability
to accomplish its goals (per 40 U.S.C.  11315 (c)(2)).
1 represents the lowest possible score and 5 represent the highest possible score.

comment.example: CIO Evaluation Report on 10/1/2020 produced a score of 5.
comment.description: Explanation and/or additional details regarding this reported value

PIID.description:
The unique identifier for each contract, agreement, or order associated with this
Investment (Federal Procurement Data Systems (FPDS) data element 1A).
Enter PIID numbers for contacts, agreements, or orders both that have already been awarded.
Completed and/or expired contracts do not need to be included.
Data definitions can be found at Federal Procurement Data System.
Please note that reference PIIDs should not be entered for this field.

referencePIID.description:
For each PIID number reported for contract support obtained via an order or call,
report the Reference PIID per FPDS instructions for element 1c.

costItem.description:
Optional descriptive name detailing the type of funding information provided within  given ledger
item

year.description: A Fiscal year associated with the funding in a given ledger item

amount.description: Funding amount for a ledger item

type.description:
Select either O&M or DME.
O&M: Operations & Maintenance Costs refers to the expenses required to operate and maintain an IT asset that is operating in a production environment.
DME: Development, Modernization, and Enhancement refers to projects and activities leading to new IT assets/systems, as well as projects and activities that change or modify existing IT assets to substantively improve capability or performance, implement legislative or regulatory requirements, or meet an Agency leadership request. DME activity may occur at any time during a programs life cycle.

costPool.description:
For ledger items selecting TBM reporting, Agencies can align funding against a Cost Pool per the
definitions for TBM v3.0 provided online by the TBM Council

ITTower.description:
For ledger items selecting TBM reporting, Agencies can align funding against a IT Tower per the
definitions for TBM v3.0 provided online by the TBM Council

budgetYear.description:
Budget Year for all ledger items, Agencies should indicate the budget reporting year associated with
the request. For example, submissions during the BY 2023 submission period that describe PY funding should use
the following data points: Budget Year of 2023 and Fiscal Year of 2021

fundingSource.description:
For ledger items selecting Funding Sources Reporting, indicate the Funding Source associated with a
given ledger item.

source.description:
For ledger items selecting Funding Sources Reporting, indicate whether the funding is associated
with 'Agency Funding' or 'Contributions'

ledgerElementStyle.description:
Indicate the type of funding data a given ledger request will provide to IT Collect. This field's
selection will trigger a series of validation checks to ensure that Agencies are providing and omitting the
relevant data points for either Funding Sources or TBM reporting. Funding Sources reporting will mandate the
inclusion of the Funding Source, Source, and Type fields. TBM reporting will mandate the inclusion of either
the Cost Pool or IT Tower field.

relevant data points for either Funding Sources or TBM reporting. Funding Sources reporting will mandate the
inclusion of the Funding Source, Source, and Type fields. TBM reporting will mandate the inclusion of either
the Cost Pool or IT Tower field.

This is used when an Investment has a change in status (e.g., downgraded to non-major IT Investment, eliminated, retired, consolidated, split) for the current budget submission relative to the previous budget cycle. The change of status should be indicated with one of the following reasons:

changeInStatusDescription.description:
This is used when an indicator has been chosen for "Change in Investment Status Identifier" in
order to provide a description of the rationale for the change, which may include impacted UIIs, specific
references to legislative requirements, or governance board decisions and effective dates.

previousUII.description:
Previous UII This is the identifier depicting Agency code and unique Investment number used to report the Investment in the previous FY 2020 Agency IT Portfolio Summary submission to OMB. Indicating the UII used for a previous submission allows cross-walk and historical analysis spanning FYs. Previous UII is mandatory, with the exception of new Investments.
Validations
  • UII {{ uii }} must match the following format: XXX-xxxxxxxxx. The first three digits represent your Agency code. The last nine digits serve as the Investment's unique identifier
  • Previous UII {{uii}} must correspond with an existing Current UII in the IT Collect database

sharedServiceCode.description:
Shared Services Code, 2 digit - 00, 24, or 48 - 00: Code for all Investments other than those coded 24 or 48. - 24: E-Gov initiatives or an individual Agency's participation in one of the EGov/LoB initiatives listed in Appendix B. - 48: Any Multi-Agency (Inter- or Intra-Agency) IT collaboration or an individual Agencys participation in one of these initiatives, such as use of a centralized FOIA portal.
Validations
  • This value should be of type {{ type }}.
  • This value should not be blank.
  • The value you selected is not a valid choice.

sharedServiceId.description:
Shared Services Identifier - 4 digits These four digits are applicable for all Investments with a Shared Services Category of 24 or 48. A code will be specifically assigned for all E-Gov/LoB shared services in Appendix B, while Agencies should assign their own four digit unique codes for Multi-Agency initiatives using the 48 shared services category. This code represents the same 4-digit identifier previously provided in the last nine digits of the UII for Investments starting with xxx-99999XXXX.
Validations

currentUii.description:
The Current UII includes an Agency code and a nine-digit unique identifier.
Variable information formerly included in the UII of previous years is not part
of the UII primary key.

title.description:
This is a text field to provide the Investment title. To the extent that they are not
part of the name used by the Agency, other identifiers such as bureaus or other
numeric codes should not be included as part of an Investment title.

description.example: Sample description of the IT Dashboard modernization process.
description.description:
Description for each Investment. This description should briefly explain the
purpose of the Investment and what program(s) it supports, including the value
to the public.

budgetYear.description: The budget year for the investment in YYYY format.

changeInStatus.description:
This is used when an Investment has a change in status (e.g., downgraded to non-major IT Investment,
eliminated, retired, consolidated, split) for the current budget submission relative to the previous budget
cycle. The change of status should be indicated with one of the following reasons:

changeInStatusDescription.description:
This is used when an indicator has been chosen for "Change in Investment Status Identifier" in
order to provide a description of the rationale for the change, which may include impacted UIIs, specific
references to legislative requirements, or governance board decisions and effective dates.

previousUII.description:
Previous UII
This is the identifier depicting Agency code and unique Investment number used
to report the Investment in the previous FY 2020 Agency IT Portfolio Summary
submission to OMB. Indicating the UII used for a previous submission
allows cross-walk and historical analysis spanning FYs. Previous
UII is mandatory, with the exception of new Investments.

sharedServiceCode.description:

- 00: Code for all Investments other than those coded 24 or 48.
- 24: E-Gov initiatives or an individual Agency's participation in one of the EGov/LoB initiatives listed in
Appendix B.
- 48: Any Multi-Agency (Inter- or Intra-Agency) IT collaboration or an individual Agencys participation
in one of these initiatives, such as use of a centralized FOIA portal.

not need to be completed.

dataCenterInventoryId.description:
Data Center Inventory ID
The unique identifier (or list of the identifiers) for any relevant data centers
from your agencys data center inventory, which is submitted to OMB on a
quarterly basis in conjunction with the Integrated Data Collection (IDC).

plannedAcquisitions.description:
Indicate whether the Investment is planning to award a contract in the next 12
months. This includes awarding new contracts or renewing an existing expiring
contract; this does not include exercising an option year.

currentUii.description:
The Current UII includes an Agency code and a nine-digit unique identifier. Variable information formerly included in the UII of previous years is not part of the UII primary key.
Validations
  • UII {{ uii }} must match the following format: XXX-xxxxxxxxx. The first three digits represent your Agency code. The last nine digits serve as the Investment's unique identifier
  • The Agency Code in UII {{ uii }} must match the submitting agency code {{ agencyCode }}
  • Current UII {{ value }} already exists in IT Collect. Please use the PATCH method to update UII {{ value }}

budgetYear.description:
The budget year for the investment in YYYY format.
Validations
  • Budget Year must be {{ year }}

agency.description:
The three digit agency code.
Validations
  • The value you selected is not a valid choice.

title.description:
This is a text field to provide the Investment title. To the extent that they are not
part of the name used by the Agency, other identifiers such as bureaus or other
numeric codes should not be included as part of an Investment title.

description.example: Sample description of the IT Dashboard modernization process.
description.description:
Description for each Investment. This description should briefly explain the
purpose of the Investment and what program(s) it supports, including the value
to the public.

changeInStatus.description:
This is used when an Investment has a change in status (e.g., downgraded to non-major IT Investment, eliminated, retired, consolidated, split) for the current budget submission relative to the previous budget cycle. The change of status should be indicated with one of the following reasons:
Validations
  • The value you selected is not a valid choice.

changeInStatusDescription.description:
This is used when an indicator has been chosen for "Change in Investment Status Identifier" in
order to provide a description of the rationale for the change, which may include impacted UIIs, specific
references to legislative requirements, or governance board decisions and effective dates.

previousUII.description:
Previous UII This is the identifier depicting Agency code and unique Investment number used to report the Investment in the previous FY 2020 Agency IT Portfolio Summary submission to OMB. Indicating the UII used for a previous submission allows cross-walk and historical analysis spanning FYs. Previous UII is mandatory, with the exception of new Investments.
Validations
  • UII {{ uii }} must match the following format: XXX-xxxxxxxxx. The first three digits represent your Agency code. The last nine digits serve as the Investment's unique identifier
  • Previous UII {{uii}} must correspond with an existing Current UII in the IT Collect database

sharedServiceCode.description:
Shared Services Code, 2 digit - 00, 24, or 48 - 00: Code for all Investments other than those coded 24 or 48. - 24: E-Gov initiatives or an individual Agency's participation in one of the EGov/LoB initiatives listed in Appendix B. - 48: Any Multi-Agency (Inter- or Intra-Agency) IT collaboration or an individual Agencys participation in one of these initiatives, such as use of a centralized FOIA portal.
Validations
  • This value should be of type {{ type }}.
  • The value you selected is not a valid choice.

sharedServiceId.description:
Shared Services Identifier - 4 digits These four digits are applicable for all Investments with a Shared Services Category of 24 or 48. A code will be specifically assigned for all E-Gov/LoB shared services in Appendix B, while Agencies should assign their own four digit unique codes for Multi-Agency initiatives using the 48 shared services category. This code represents the same 4-digit identifier previously provided in the last nine digits of the UII for Investments starting with xxx-99999XXXX.
Validations
  • This value should be of type {{ type }}.
  • This value should satisfy at least one of the following constraints:

missionSupportCategory.description:
Mission Support Category - 2 digit code - 01, 02, 03, 04, 05, 06, or 07 These two digits indicate the category of common Mission Support Services Investments by Federal Integrated Business Framework (FIBF) Service Area(s). All non-Mission Support Services Investments should use Category 01. Mission Support Services Investments may select more than one code where applicable: - 01: Not Applicable - 02: Financial Management - 03: Human Resources - 04: Procurement - 05: Travel / Transportation - 06: Grants Management - 07: Other
Validations
  • This value should be of type {{ type }}.
  • The value you selected is not a valid choice.

bureauCode.description:
Bureau Code (string) - 2 digit code The two digits indicate the bureau code of the Investment (see Appendix C of OMB Circular No. A-11). If this is a department-level or an Agency-wide activity, use 00 as your bureau code.
Validations
  • This value should be of type {{ type }}.
  • One of the following Length errors:
    1) This value is too short. It should have {{ limit }} character or more.|This value is too short. It should have {{ limit }} characters or more..
    2) This value is too long. It should have {{ limit }} character or less.|This value is too long. It should have {{ limit }} characters or less..
    3) Required and must be 2 characters long.
    4) This value does not match the expected {{ charset }} charset..

partOfAITPS.description:
Part of AITPS (string) - 2 digit code - 01, 02, or 03 These two digits indicate one of the three parts of the Agency IT Portfolio Summary, to which the Investment belongs: - 01: Part 1. IT Investments for Mission Delivery - 02: Part 2. IT Investments for Mission Support Services - 03: Part 3. IT Investments for IT Infrastructure, IT Security, and IT Management
Validations
  • This value should be of type {{ type }}.
  • The value you selected is not a valid choice.

standardIdCategory.description:
Standard IT Infrastructure and Management Category 2 digit code - 01, 02, 03, 04, 05, 06, 07 ,08, 09, or 10 These two digits indicate the sub-category of Investments identified as Part 3: IT Investments for IT Infrastructure, IT Security, and IT Management. For the FY 2021 reporting cycle, the four previous optional Standard Investments Output, Application, Delivery, and Platform will now be required. All Part 3 Investments should select one of the following codes other than 01: Not Applicable, while all Part 1 and 2 Investments should select 01: Not Applicable. - 01: Not Applicable - 02: IT Security and Compliance - 03: IT Management - 04: Network - 05: Data Center and Cloud - 06: End User - 07: Output - 08: Application - 09: Delivery - 10: Platform
Validations
  • This value should be of type {{ type }}.
  • The value you selected is not a valid choice.

missionSupportArea.description:
Mission Delivery and Management Support Area - 2 digit code These two digits indicate the mission delivery and management support areas. Agencies should assign a unique code for each mission delivery and management support area reported.
Validations
  • This value should be of type {{ type }}.
  • One of the following Length errors:
    1) This value is too short. It should have {{ limit }} character or more.|This value is too short. It should have {{ limit }} characters or more..
    2) This value is too long. It should have {{ limit }} character or less.|This value is too long. It should have {{ limit }} characters or less..
    3) Required and must be 2 digit long.
    4) This value does not match the expected {{ charset }} charset..

investmentType.description:
Type of Investment - 2 digit code - 01, 02, 03, 04, or 05 These two digits indicate the type of Investment being reported as follows: - 01: Major IT Investments - 02: Non-major IT Investments - 03: IT Migration Investment: The portion of a larger asset and for which there is an existing Business Case for the overall asset. The description of the IT Investment should indicate the UII of the major asset Investment of the managing partner. - 04: Funding Transfer Investments: These are primarily used to indicate the partner contribution to a Lead Agency Investment through inter- or intraAgency transfers. The description of the IT Investment should indicate the UII of the Lead Agencys Investment. - 05: Standard IT Infrastructure Investments in Part 3: IT Infrastructure, IT Security, IT Management Investments (IT Security and Compliance, IT Management, Network, Data Center and Cloud, End User, Output, Application, Delivery, and Platform).
Validations
  • This value should be of type {{ type }}.
  • The value you selected is not a valid choice.

nssId.description:
National Security Systems Identifier - 2 digit code - 01 or 02 These two digits indicate whether the Investment is a National Security System the Federal Information Security Management Act of 2002 (FISMA), 44 U.S.C. 3542(b)(2) as follows: - 01: Non-National Security System Investment - 02: National Security System Investment (these investments will not be publicly viewable on the IT Dashboard)
Validations
  • This value should be of type {{ type }}.
  • The value you selected is not a valid choice.

publicUrls.description:
Public URL(s) List any website or digital service that is supported primarily by this Investment. Supply an array of strings (URLS).
Validations
  • Public URLs must contain valid URLs. Found {{count}} invalid URL(s): {{urls}}

serviceArea.description:
Primary service area (string) - 3 digit code This is the three digit code that indicates the predominant business function served by the Investment (not necessarily the Agencys mission/business). BRM version 3.1 contains the current mapping codes.
Validations
  • This value should be of type {{ type }}.
  • One of the following Length errors:
    1) This value is too short. It should have {{ limit }} character or more.|This value is too short. It should have {{ limit }} characters or more..
    2) This value is too long. It should have {{ limit }} character or less.|This value is too long. It should have {{ limit }} characters or less..
    3) Required and must be 3 digit long.
    4) This value does not match the expected {{ charset }} charset..

cloudComputingEvaluation.description:
Cloud Computing Alternatives Evaluation - 1 digit - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6 This specifies whether, as of the date of the submission, the Investment, or a component of the Investment, is leveraging, considering, migrating or posing as a candidate for cloud computing. All Investments are required to answer this question regardless of the overall life cycle stage of the Investment, as operational Investments should consider cloud computing alternatives during or as a result of an operational analysis. Select one of the following answers: - 1: This Investment or a portion of this Investment is leveraging cloud computing. - 2: This Investment is migrating to the cloud. - 3: This Investment is considering cloud computing. - 4: Cloud computing has NOT been considered. - 5: Cloud computing is NOT applicable for any portion of this Investment. - 6: Cloud computing has been considered but was not selected. Note: For Funding Transfer Investments (Investment Type 04), this field does not need to be completed.
Validations
  • The value you selected is not a valid choice.

oauth.description:
IT Collect will utilize the OAuth2 Authorization framework to authenticate vendor client
applications to start using our APIs. A walkthrough of client configuration for Postman is
outlined below. All current documentation and application features are currently undergoing
development.

## Prerequisites
- Request an OAuth 2 identifer and secret from IT Collect team.
- Request a sandbox user account.

## Postman

[Postman](https://www.postman.com/) is an API Client that you can use for communication
with IT Collect

### Steps (without PIV card)

1. Create a new Postman Collection and import the openAPI spec

2. Edit the Collection

3. Switch to the Authorization tab and select `OAuth 2.0`

4. Click the "Get New Access Token" button leaving Header Prefix as `Bearer`.

| Setting | Value |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| Token Name | Bearer |
| Grant Type | Authorization Code |
| * Callback URL | https://app.getpostman.com/oauth2/callback |
| * Authorize using browser | *leave unchecked, see Steps (with PIV / Login.gov)* |
| Auth URL (TBD) | https://dev-itcollect-oauth.itcollect.domain/oauth/authorize |
| Access Token URL (TBD) | https://dev-itcollect-oauth.itcollect.domain.com/oauth/token |
| Client ID | *{Request from IT Collect}* |
| Client Secret | *{Request from IT Collect}* |
| Scope (TBD) |  |
| * State |  |
| Client Authentication | Send client credentials in body |

> * Callback URL: Vendor application callback URL.  Will depend on individual vendor
implementation.  Must be provided to IT Collect team prior to implementation.
> * State: This is an optional parameter, leave blank in Postman, but you may provide a
state in your vendor application. You may use this as CSRF protection mechanism or to
assist in maintaining a state such as a session key.

5. Click "Request Token"

6. Login using either your sandbox user account or your login.gov account.

You should now have an access token suitable for defining the HTTP Authorization Header.

### Steps (with Login.gov PIV card)

PIV (Personal Identity Verification) cards testing steps

1. Using the same steps as above enable the "Authorize using browser" checkbox. This should
change the `Callback URL` to `https://oauth.pstmn.io/v1/callback`.

2. Click "Request Token"

3. Once the browser window has opened (you may need to allow popups in your browse for this
domain) click "Login with Login.gov"

4. Provide your Login.gov credentials using either your PIV access card or username and
password credentials.

You should now have an access token suitable for defining in the HTTP Authorization Header.
